ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
Level 1: school leaving certification; level 2: high school study level; level 3: high school diploma and higer education

ElementDescription: Treatment arms of this study. Individualized therapy (RECOS program) compared with the more general Cognitive Remediation Therapy (CRT)

Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: Behavioral Assesment of Dysexecutive Symptoms; standardised score
Rule Shift Cards Test profile score
Notes: 4= 0 errors; 3=1 to 3 errors; 2= 4 to 6 errors; 1= 7 to 9 errors; 0 - 10 or more errors
4= 5 completed stages; 3= 4 completed stages; 2=3 completed stages; 1= 2 completed stages; 0 = 1 or less completed stages

ElementDescription: Modified Six Elements Test profile score
